titleStmt.title: NymList of mostly Arabic and Ottoman Turkish names and titles in Damascus and its vicinity, 1850s-1910s
titleStmt.author: Till Grallert

publicationStmt.p: The file was originally created in November 2012 and is continuously updated through manual and automated input by the original author.

This NymList of names, titles, and, increasingly, entities in Arabic, Ottoman Turkish, and their various spellings was produced semi-automatically from a corpus of some 15.000 newspaper articles,consular letters, and journal entries

As it stands, the file contains a large number of multiple-word nyms. While this makes perfect sense for names such as "ʿAbd Allah", "Badr al-Dīn" etc., it is not necessary for "ʿUmar Rushdī". The latter had been included due to some early search functions, but should be deleted from this file.

Principal Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs

editorialDecl.p: Languages: According to TEI P5 @xml:lang should follow BCP 47 , which specifies for Arabic in Latin transcription "ar-Latn". The specific type of transcription should be added as a private use subtag, i.e. "ar-Latn-x-ijmes" for the IJMES transcription of Arabic in Latin script. The tag for Ottoman Turkish is "ota". Persian is rendered as "fa". For transcription in Latin script following the IJMES transcription, it would be "ota-Latn-x-ijmes" and "fa-Latn-x-ijmes". The English variant of Latinised Arabic would be "ar-Latn-EN" and the French "ar-Latn-FR"
There is a XSLT stylesheet for this "TeiXmlLandCodes".

Name types: any name can carry a @type="variant" to indicate variant spellings. surnames can be of @type "short" or "long". Some Arabic names consist of more than one word and are marked as @type="phrase". Entities can carry the type "abbr"

As search and normalizing functions further down the work-flow include replacement functions for up-marking and down-marking IJMES and other diacritics, it is not necessary to include both "Muḥammad" and "Muhammad". Such a search function produces a lot of computing overhead and thus it was replaced with pre-computed nyms in this file. There is a XSLT stylesheet for this: "TeiNym AddNormalizedForms v1.xsl" [ "TeiMarkDown"].
It is still unclear, how to deal with placeNames. Various entries are included in a different file ("LocationsMasterTEI").

revisionDesc.change: updated with new names from the PersMaster
updated with new names from the PersMaster
re-integrated nyms for the social structure, which were lost at some point between August and November since they were nested into other nyms
corrected the xml:lang codes to comply with TEI
Added new nyms, corrected the forenames, corrected surnames
Manually removed all multi-word nyms that make no sense in Arabic
Added automatically generated normalized forms of each tei:form with an @xml:lang attribute that contained "x-ijmes". These forms have been labelled as @type="normalized".
